@description.name: @description
@description
@description.body: Constructor. The promise function is called with two parameters, functions which are to be called when the promise is fulfilled or rejected respectively. If you do not provide any parameters, the promise can be externally resolved or rejected by calling the resolve() or reject() methods.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: fn {Function} the promise function called with (resolve, reject)
@param.description: the promise function called with (resolve, reject)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object?} optional context for all callbacks
@param.description: optional context for all callbacks

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Destructor

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The Promise

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Stores data for completing the promise externally

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a promise which is determined by the functions onFulfilled and onRejected.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
onFulfilled {Function} called when the Promise is fulfilled. This function
has one argument, the fulfillment value.
@param.description:
called when the Promise is fulfilled. This function
has one argument, the fulfillment value.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
onRejected {Function?} called when the Promise is rejected. This function
has one argument, the rejection reason.
@param.description:
called when the Promise is rejected. This function
has one argument, the rejection reason.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise}

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Appends a rejection handler callback to the promise, and returns a new promise
resolving to the return value of the callback if it is called, or to its original
fulfillment value if the promise is instead fulfilled.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
onRejected {Function?} called when the Promise is rejected. This function
has one argument, the rejection reason.
@param.description:
called when the Promise is rejected. This function
has one argument, the rejection reason.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} a qx.Promise is rejected if onRejected throws an error or
returns a Promise which is itself rejected; otherwise, it is resolved.
@return.desc:
a qx.Promise is rejected if onRejected throws an error or
returns a Promise which is itself rejected; otherwise, it is resolved.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates a new qx.Promise with the 'this' set to a different context

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object} the 'this' context for the new Promise
@param.description: the 'this' context for the new Promise

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise} the new promise

@description.name: @description

@param.name: @param
@param.body: fulfilledHandler {Function} called when the Promises are fulfilled.
@param.description: called when the Promises are fulfilled.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise}

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Appends a handler that will be called regardless of this promise's fate. The handler
is not allowed to modify the value of the promise

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
handler {Function?} called when the Promise is fulfilled or rejected. This function
has no arguments, but can return a promise
@param.description:
called when the Promise is fulfilled or rejected. This function
has no arguments, but can return a promise

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise} a qx.Promise chained from this promise
@return.desc: a qx.Promise chained from this promise

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Cancel this promise. Will not do anything if this promise is already settled.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Same as {@link qx.Promise.all} except that it iterates over the value of this promise, when it is fulfilled; for example, if this Promise resolves to an Iterable (eg an Array), .all will return a Promise that waits for all promises in that Iterable to be fullfilled. The Iterable can be a mix of values and Promises

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Same as {@link qx.Promise.race} except that it iterates over the value of this promise, when it is fulfilled; for example, if this Promise resolves to an Iterable (eg an Array), .race will return a Promise that waits until the first promise in that Iterable has been fullfilled. The Iterable can be a mix of values and Promises

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Same as {@link qx.Promise.some} except that it iterates over the value of this promise, when it is fulfilled. Like some, with 1 as count. However, if the promise fulfills, the fulfillment value is not an array of 1 but the value directly.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise}

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Same as {@link qx.Promise.some} except that it iterates over the value of this promise, when
it is fulfilled; return a promise that is fulfilled as soon as count promises are fulfilled
in the array. The fulfillment value is an array with count values in the order they were fulfilled.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: iterable {Iterable} An iterable object, such as an Array
@param.description: An iterable object, such as an Array

@param.name: @param
@param.body: count {Integer}

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Same as {@link qx.Promise.forEach} except that it iterates over the value of this promise, when it is fulfilled; iterates over the values with the given iterator function with the signature (value, index, length) where value is the resolved value. Iteration happens serially. If any promise is rejected the returned promise is rejected as well. Resolves to the original array unmodified, this method is meant to be used for side effects. If the iterator function returns a promise or a thenable, then the result of the promise is awaited, before continuing with next iteration.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: iterable {Iterable} An iterable object, such as an Array
@param.description: An iterable object, such as an Array

@param.name: @param
@param.body: iterator {Function} the callback, with (value, index, length)
@param.description: the callback, with (value, index, length)

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise}

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Same as {@link qx.Promise.filter} except that it iterates over the value of this promise, when it is fulfilled;
iterates over all the values into an array and filter the array to another using the given filterer function.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: iterable {Iterable} An iterable object, such as an Array
@param.description: An iterable object, such as an Array

@param.name: @param
@param.body: iterator {Function} the callback, with (value, index, length)
@param.description: the callback, with (value, index, length)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Object?} options; can be: concurrency max nuber of simultaneous filters, default is Infinity
@param.description: options; can be: concurrency max nuber of simultaneous filters, default is Infinity

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise}

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Same as {@link qx.Promise.map} except that it iterates over the value of this promise, when it is fulfilled;
iterates over all the values into an array and map the array to another using the given mapper function.

Promises returned by the mapper function are awaited for and the returned promise doesn't fulfill
until all mapped promises have fulfilled as well. If any promise in the array is rejected, or
any promise returned by the mapper function is rejected, the returned promise is rejected as well.

The mapper function for a given item is called as soon as possible, that is, when the promise
for that item's index in the input array is fulfilled. This doesn't mean that the result array
has items in random order, it means that .map can be used for concurrency coordination unlike
.all.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: iterable {Iterable} An iterable object, such as an Array
@param.description: An iterable object, such as an Array

@param.name: @param
@param.body: iterator {Function} the callback, with (value, index, length)
@param.description: the callback, with (value, index, length)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Object?} options; can be: concurrency max nuber of simultaneous filters, default is Infinity
@param.description: options; can be: concurrency max nuber of simultaneous filters, default is Infinity

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise}

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Same as {@link qx.Promise.mapSeries} except that it iterates over the value of this promise, when
it is fulfilled; iterates over all the values into an array and iterate over the array serially,
in-order.

Returns a promise for an array that contains the values returned by the iterator function in their
respective positions. The iterator won't be called for an item until its previous item, and the
promise returned by the iterator for that item are fulfilled. This results in a mapSeries kind of
utility but it can also be used simply as a side effect iterator similar to Array#forEach.

If any promise in the input array is rejected or any promise returned by the iterator function is
rejected, the result will be rejected as well.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: iterable {Iterable} An iterable object, such as an Array
@param.description: An iterable object, such as an Array

@param.name: @param
@param.body: iterator {Function} the callback, with (value, index, length)
@param.description: the callback, with (value, index, length)

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Same as {@link qx.Promise.reduce} except that it iterates over the value of this promise, when it is fulfilled; iterates over all the values in the Iterable into an array and reduce the array to a value using the given reducer function. If the reducer function returns a promise, then the result of the promise is awaited, before continuing with next iteration. If any promise in the array is rejected or a promise returned by the reducer function is rejected, the result is rejected as well. If initialValue is undefined (or a promise that resolves to undefined) and the iterable contains only 1 item, the callback will not be called and the iterable's single item is returned. If the iterable is empty, the callback will not be called and initialValue is returned (which may be undefined). qx.Promise.reduce will start calling the reducer as soon as possible, this is why you might want to use it over qx.Promise.all (which awaits for the entire array before you can call Array#reduce on it).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: iterable {Iterable} An iterable object, such as an Array
@param.description: An iterable object, such as an Array

@param.name: @param
@param.body: reducer {Function} the callback, with (value, index, length)
@param.description: the callback, with (value, index, length)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: initialValue {Object?} optional initial value
@param.description: optional initial value

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: External promise handler

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the data stored by __externalPromise, throws an exception once processed

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resolves an external promise

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Rejects an external promise

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper method used to call Promise methods which iterate over an array

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper method used to call a Promise method

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the actual Promise implementation.

Note that Bluebird is the current implementation, and may change without
notice in the future; if you use this API you accept that this is a private
implementation detail exposed for debugging or diagnosis purposes only.  For
this reason, the toPromise() method is listed as deprecated starting from the
first release

@deprecated.name: @deprecated
@deprecated.body: {6.0} this API method is subject to change

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The bind method delegates the call to the
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} function. As source, the current
object (this) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
sourcePropertyChain {String} The property chain which represents
the source property.
@param.description:
The property chain which represents
the source property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetObject {qx.core.Object} The object which the source should
be bind to.
@param.description:
The object which the source should
be bind to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: targetProperty {String} The property name of the target object.
@param.description: The property name of the target object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
options {Map} A map containing the options. See
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
information.
@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} A promise which is resolved when the initial value
has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.desc:
A promise which is resolved when the initial value
has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
there is no property definition for object and property (source and
target).

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Removes the binding with the given id from the current object. The
id has to be the id returned by any of the bind functions.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {var} The id of the binding.
@param.description: The id of the binding.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the binding could not be found.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes all bindings between the object and the related one.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
relatedObject {qx.core.Object} The object of which related
bindings should be removed.
@param.description:
The object of which related
bindings should be removed.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array which lists all bindings for the object.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array} An array of binding informations. Every binding
information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
targetObject and targetProperty in that order.
@return.desc:
An array of binding informations. Every binding
information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
targetObject and targetProperty in that order.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add event listener to this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
self {Object ? null} Reference to the 'this' variable inside
the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
usually falls back to a default, which is the target
by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.
@param.description:
Reference to the 'this' variable inside
the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
usually falls back to a default, which is the target
by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.desc:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description

Add event listener to this object, which is only called once. After the
listener is called the event listener gets removed.

@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param

@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object ? window} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.desc:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@return.desc: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Create an event object and dispatch it on this object.
The event dispatched with this method does never bubble! Use only if you
are sure that bubbling is not required.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.desc:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an non-bubbling data event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} User defined data attached to the event object
@param.description: User defined data attached to the event object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: oldData {var?null} The event's old data (optional)
@param.description: The event's old data (optional)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cancelable {Boolean?false} Whether or not an event can have its default
action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
{@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}
@param.description:
Whether or not an event can have its default
action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
{@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.desc:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Sets multiple properties at once by using a property list or
sets one property and its value by the first and second argument.
As a fallback, if no generated property setter could be found, a
handwritten setter will be searched and invoked if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {Map | String} a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.
@param.description: a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {var?} the value, only used when data is a string.
@param.description: the value, only used when data is a string.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Object} Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.
@return.desc: Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the value of the given property. If no generated getter could be
found, a fallback tries to access a handwritten getter.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property.
@param.description: Name of the property.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The value of the value

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Resets the value of the given property. If no generated resetter could be
found, a handwritten resetter will be invoked, if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property.
@param.description: Name of the property.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Checks if the property is initialized, i.e. has a defined init value or
has got a value by a setter method.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property
@param.description: Name of the property

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} If the property is initialized

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the property defined does not exist
